translation: Has there come to you the story of the Overwhelming Event?
On that Day, some faces will be humiliated,
overburdened and weary[1],
footnotes: [1] They will be burdened with the heavy shackles in the Hereafter, or they performed deeds in their worldly life which were bereft of faith or not done for the sake of Allah.

translation: as they burn in a scorching Fire.
They will be made to drink from a boiling spring,

arabic_text: لَّيۡسَ لَهُمۡ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٖ
translation: and they will have no food except bitter thorny plants,

arabic_text: لَّا يُسۡمِنُ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِن جُوعٖ
translation: that neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger.
Other faces on that Day will be joyful,
well-pleased with their past striving,
in an elevated garden,
wherein no idle talk will be heard[2].
footnotes: [2] Rather than an insult, falsehood, immorality, etc.

translation: There will be a flowing spring;
and couches raised high,
and cups placed ready,
and cushions lined up,
and splendid carpets spread out.

arabic_text: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡإِبِلِ كَيۡفَ خُلِقَتۡ
translation: Do they not reflect on the camel, how it is created;
and the sky, how it is raised high;
and the mountains, how they are firmly set up;
and the earth, how it is spread out?
So remind [O Prophet]; your duty is only to remind;
you are not assigned to compel them.
But whoever turns away and disbelieves,
Allah will inflict upon him the greatest punishment[3].
footnotes: [3] i.e., the greatest punishment is the Hellfire. The minor punishment includes disasters in worldly life and grave punishment.

translation: Indeed, to Us is their return,
then it is for Us to call them to account.
